column4: nevermind, obviously I can't plug my cable modem into one ethernet card then have that same ethernet card for the inside network
I think the thing that made me fall in love with ubuntu and linux in general were two things: mt-dappd and hellanzb
At least when things break in Linux there are decent error messages as opposed to Windows
just when things do have problems cause I screwed something up
No, I meant /Var/log was MUCH better than the hex
One thing that does bug me. When I start Konsole in Gnome it seems to take about a second to load. Under debian it seemed to load faster. Is something possibly misconfigured?
Or is there a gnome terminal prog I should be using
a whole SECOND??? Oh dear! and aterm's faster
gnome-terminal's popular, but it messes with keybindings a lot.
it may have something to do with needing to load QT libraries in gnome or something
if you're booted to it, it'll be used...
it's because you've got its meta-package involved...i think it's linux-386 or something
